text:
Sir Brian James Lochore (3 September 1940 – 3 August 2019) was a New Zealand rugby union player and coach. He captained the New Zealand national team, the All Blacks. He played at number 8 and lock, as well as captaining the side 46 times (18 of those tests).
In 1999, Lochore was added into the International Rugby Hall of Fame.
Lochore died of bowel cancer in Masterton, New Zealand on 3 August 2019 at the age of 78.
